definition: to dispatch a vehicle/(of a vehicle or its driver) to set off

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
surname Che
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
war chariot (archaic)/rook (in Chinese chess)/rook (in chess)

sentences.english: The driver delayed the drive until the weather cleared.
sentences.chinese: 驾驶员延迟到天气转晴后才出车。

sentences.english: She leaned out of the window and hailed a passerby.
sentences.chinese: 她探出车窗口，向一个过路人打招呼。

sentences.english: The passenger slowly climbed out toinvestigate.
sentences.chinese: 那名乘客慢慢地爬出车去查看。

sentences.english: These accidents always cause traffic jams on rainy days.
sentences.chinese: 下雨天出车祸往往引起堵车。

sentences.english: He says he got out of his car with his gun.
sentences.chinese: 他说他拿着枪爬出车，开了四枪打死了那个人。

sentences.english: Eventually, I was let out of the car and cited for disorderly conduct.
sentences.chinese: 最后，我被拉出车，并被以“行为不捡”被传唤。

sentences.english: What if I get into a car accident right now?
After the accident,the car was bent up in all directions.
sentences.chinese: 出车祸后，那辆车乱转了。

sentences.english: The reason why the traffic was blocked was that an accident happened ahead.
sentences.chinese: 交通受阻的原因就是前面出车祸了。

sentences.english: She doesn't answer; she's thinking about throwing herself out of the car.
sentences.chinese: 她没有回答，她在想着怎样把自己扔出车外。

sentences.english: You're heading for an accident if you drive after drinking.
sentences.chinese: 如果你酒后开车，会闯出车祸。

sentences.english: If you drive too fast, you may get into a car accident.
sentences.chinese: 如果你车开太快的话，你有可能会出车祸。

sentences.english: You can drive tonight if you are ready。
sentences.chinese: 你今晚就可以出车，如果你愿意的话。

sentences.english: The brakes wouldn't act, so there was an accident.
sentences.chinese: 刹车不起作用了，所以才出车祸。

sentences.english: Bright flash from the track can clearly determine the speed of the bus.
sentences.chinese: 从亮点闪过惪轨迹中可明显地判断出车惪速度。

sentences.english: Grab the keys from the kidnapper's car and throw them out the window.
sentences.chinese: 抢到绑匪的车钥匙扔出车窗外。

definition: chauffeur/driver/CL:個|个[ge4]
to uncouple (wagons or trucks from a train)
car door/door of bus, railway carriage etc
(northern dialect) to pick up a fare (as a taxi driver)/to pick up a piece of work (as a courier)
car or other vehicle (bicycle, truck etc)
to drive a car
surname Che
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
war chariot (archaic)/rook (in Chinese chess)/rook (in chess)
to repair a bike (car etc)
car window/window of vehicle (bus, train etc)
copilot/front passenger seat
to pull up (stop one's vehicle)/to park/(of a machine) to stop working/to stall
to go (of car, train etc)/to drive off
handlebar (bicycle etc)/shaft (rickshaw etc)
pedicab/tricycle
coach
taxi/(Tw) rental car
